intro: Carex dominii, commonly known as the Domin's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences, which contain small, wind-pollinated flowers. Native to specific regions in Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in woodland or wetland habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces distinctive, three-sided stems. Its botanical features make it an important component of diverse ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird species.
